Annotations Filled shapes On this page Filled shapes CodeOpen sandbox Rectangle​ (x1,y1)(x2,y2) CodeOpen sandbox Props​ Mandatory​ x1: first corner horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y1: first corner vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue x2: second corner horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y2: second corner vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue Optional​ color: fill color type: string default: "black" all <rect> svg props are supported. For more information visit the documentation Circle​ (x,y)r CodeOpen sandbox Props​ Mandatory​ x: centers horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y: centers vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue r: circle radius type: ScalarValue Optional​ color: fill color type: string default: "black" all <circle> svg props are supported. For more information visit the documentation Ellipse​ (x,y)rxry CodeOpen sandbox Props​ Mandatory​ x: centers horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y: centers vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue rx: radius on the horizontal axis type: ScalarValue ry: radius on the vertical axis type: ScalarValue Optional​ color: fill color type: string default: "black" all <ellipse> svg props are supported for more information visit the documentation DirectedEllipse​ (x1,y1)(x2,y2)width CodeOpen sandbox Props​ Mandatory​ x1: first corner horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y1: first corner vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue x2: second corner horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y2: second corner vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue width: ellipse width type: ScalarValue Optional​ color: fill color type: string default: "black" all <ellipse> svg props are supported. For more information visit the documentation Polygon​ P1P2P3P4P5 CodeOpen sandbox Props​ Mandatory​ points: series of points type: Array<{ x: ScalarValue, y: ScalarValue }> Optional​ color: fill color type: string default: "black" all <polygon> svg props are supported. For more information visit the documentation Shape​ CodeOpen sandbox Props​ Mandatory​ x: horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y: vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue size: shape size type: number shape: shape name type: 'triangle' | 'circle' | 'diamond' | 'square' Optional​ color: fill color type: string default: "black" style: customises shape styling type: CSSProperties default: {} onMouseEnter: mouse enter event callback type: MouseEventHandler<SVGGElement> onMouseLeave: mouse leave event callback type: MouseEventHandler<SVGGElement> Edit this page Previous Text Next Other shapes Rectangle Props Circle Props Ellipse Props DirectedEllipse Props Polygon Props Shape Props

Annotations Group On this page Group Group is a container used to group other Annotations Hello, World! CodeOpen sandbox Restriction​ Group must have at least one child Props​ Mandatory​ x: horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y: vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue Optional​ style: customizes group children style type: CSSProperties default: {} horizontalAlign: changes group horizontal align type: 'start' | 'middle' | 'end' | 'none' default: none verticalAlign: changes group vertical align type: 'start' | 'middle' | 'end' | 'none' default: 'none' horizontalAlign='none'Hello!(x,y) horizontalAlign='start'Hello!(x,y) horizontalAlign='middle'Hello!(x,y) horizontalAlign='end'Hello!(x,y) CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Other shapes Next Introduction Restriction Props

Annotations Introduction On this page Introduction react-plot allows adding several elements to our plot, which helps us to visualize more data, simplify it, add interaction with the plot... Hello world CodeOpen sandbox Restriction​ Annotations must be inside the Annotation component, they cannot be placed directly inside Plot, otherwise you would get the following error: invalid plot child Annotations​ There are 3 categories each one may contain many annotations : Text Filled shapes Rectangle Circle Ellipse DirectedEllipse Polygon Shape Other shapes Line Arrow Polyline Group Edit this page Previous ParallelAxis Next Text Restriction Annotations

Annotations Other shapes On this page Other shapes CodeOpen sandbox Line​ (x1,y1)(x2,y2) CodeOpen sandbox Props​ Mandatory​ x1: start point horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y1: start point vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue x2: end point horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y2: end point vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue Optional​ color: stroke color type: string default: "black" all <line> svg props are supported. For more information visit the documentation Arrow​ startPoint="circle"endPoint="triangle" CodeOpen sandbox same as Line with 2 more special props : startPoint: shape added to starting point type: 'circle' | 'triangle' | 'line' | 'none' default: "none" endPoint: shape added to ending point type: 'circle' | 'triangle' | 'line' | 'none' default: "none" Polyline​ P1P2P3P4P5 CodeOpen sandbox Props​ Mandatory​ points: series of points type: Array<{ x: ScalarValue, y: ScalarValue }> Optional​ color: stroke color type: string default: "black" all <polygone> svg props are supported. For more information visit the documentation Edit this page Previous Filled shapes Next Group Line Props Arrow Polyline Props

Annotations Text On this page Text Text annotation allows adding personalised text to plot in a specific position Hello world CodeOpen sandbox Props​ Mandatory​ x: horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y: vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue Optional​ color: content color type: string default: "black" all <text> svg props are supported. For more information visit the documentation Edit this page Previous Introduction Next Filled shapes Props Mandatory Optional

Axes Axis On this page Axis Axis is a component that allows you to add different personalised axes in your Plot CodeOpen sandbox Restriction​ In a Plot, we cannot have two Axis in the same position Example: Adding two bottom axes in the same plot will throw the following error : Plot can only have one bottom axis Props​ 1. Axis Positon​ position: a mandatory prop that allows you to choose axis position type: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' CodeOpen sandbox 2. Axis Range​ CodeOpen sandbox min: axis minimum domain value type: number default: calculated automatically based on series data max: axis maximum domain value type: number default: calculated automatically based on series data CodeOpen sandbox paddingStart: added value to range in the beginning of domain type: ScalarValue default: 0 paddingEnd: added value to range in the end of domain type: ScalarValue default: 0 CodeOpen sandbox 3. Identify Axis​ id: value used to identify an axis using a string type: string default:"x" for horizontal axis,"y" for vertical axis CodeOpen sandbox scale: Axis scale type type: 'linear' | 'log' | 'time' default:'linear' CodeOpen sandbox 4. Choose Axis Behaviour​ flip: used to flip axis type: boolean default: false CodeOpen sandbox hidden: Hides all axis elements type: boolean default: false CodeOpen sandbox 5. Customize Axis​ a. Line​ hiddenLine: hides axis line type: boolean default: false lineStyle: changes axis line style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox b. Label​ label: Axis label type: ReactNode default: "" labelStyle: changes label style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox c. Grid​ displayPrimaryGridLines: adds simple grid lines to the plot type: boolean default: false primaryGridLineStyle: customises grid lines style type: CSSProperties default: {} displaySecondaryGridLines: adds secondary grid lines to the plot type: boolean default: false secondaryGridLineStyle: changes secondary style of grid lines type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox d. Ticks​ hiddenTicks: Hides axis ticks type: boolean default: false CodeOpen sandbox tickPosition: changes ticks position type: 'inner' | 'outer' | 'center' default: 'center' CodeOpen sandbox primaryTickLength: changes primary ticks length type: number default: 5 primaryTickStyle: customises primary ticks style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox secondaryTickLength: changes secondary ticks length type: number default: 3 secondaryTickStyle: customises secondary ticks style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox e. Ticks labels​ tickLabelFormat: personalises the format of tick labels type: (x: number)=>string default: d3's smart tickFormat for time scale, String for others tickLabelStyle: changes tick labels style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Introduction Next ParallelAxis Restriction Props 1. Axis Positon 2. Axis Range 3. Identify Axis 4. Choose Axis Behaviour 5. Customize Axis

Axes Introduction On this page Introduction Axes are one of the main components in react-plot There are currently 2 different components to represent your Axes: Axis Parallel Axis They must be direct children of the Plot component and you may have several on the same plot. Default Axes​ Adding any Series in your plot will create automatically two basic axis CodeOpen sandbox Example​ CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous RangeSeries Next Axis Default Axes Example

Axes ParallelAxis On this page ParallelAxis ParallelAxis is a component used to create a parallel axis to an existed Axis, we must fix base axis id CodeOpen sandbox Props​ 1. Identify Axis​ id: mandatory prop that specifies the base axis type: string 2. Choose Axis Behaviour​ hidden: Hides all axis elements type: boolean default: false CodeOpen sandbox 3. Personlise Axis​ a. Line​ hiddenLine: Hides axis line type: boolean default: false lineStyle: changes line style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox b. Label​ label: labels Axis type: ReactNode default: "" labelStyle: changes label style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox c. Ticks​ hiddenTicks: Hides axis ticks type: boolean default: false CodeOpen sandbox tickPosition: changes ticks position type: 'inner' | 'outer' | 'center' default: 'center' CodeOpen sandbox primaryTickLength: changes primary ticks length type: number default: 5 primaryTickStyle: customises primary ticks style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox secondaryTickLength: changes secondary ticks length type: number default: 3 secondaryTickStyle: customises secondary ticks style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox d. Ticks labels​ tickLabelFormat: personnalises the format of tick labels type: (x: number)=>string default: d3's smart tickFormat for time scale, String for others tickLabelStyle: changes tick labels style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Axis Next Introduction Props 1. Identify Axis 2. Choose Axis Behaviour 3. Personlise Axis

BoxPlot On this page BoxPlot BoxPlot shows summary statistics of data in a graphical form. The graphic below shows a bloxplot superimposed on a scatter plot of the dataset. CodeOpen sandbox Props​ Mandatory​ min: Minumum value in the dataset type: ScalarValue max: Maximum value in the dataset type: ScalarValue q1: First Quartile of the dataset type: ScalarValue median: Median of the dataset type: ScalarValue q3: Third Quartile of the dataset type: ScalarValue width: Width of the boxplot type: ScalarValue y: y location of the boxplot type: ScalarValue Optional​ xAxis?: The xAxis type: string default: x yAxis?: The yAxis type: string default: y medianColor?: Color name of the median line type: string default: black medianStyle?: CSS properties of the median line type: CSSProperties default: {} boxColor?: Color name of the box type: string default: black boxStyle?: CSS Properties of the box type: CSSProperties default: {} whiskerColor?: Color name of the whisker lines type: string default: black whiskerStyle?: CSS Properties of the whisker lines type: CSSProperties default: {} minMaxColor?: Color name of the min/max lines type: string default: black minMaxStyle?: CSS Properties of the min/max lines type: CSSProperties default: {} onMouseEnter?: Handler for MouseEnter events type: MouseEventHandler<SVGGElement> default: {} onMouseLeave?: Handler for MouseLeave events type: MouseEventHandler<SVGGElement> default: {} Edit this page Previous Plot Next Introduction Props Mandatory Optional

Getting Started Basics On this page Basics There are several components in react-plot divided to 5 basic categories: Plot : the container of all other components Series : branch of components allow us to add different Graphs Axes : component that represents plot axis Annotations : where we can add different shapes to our plot Illustrations : allows to explain plot formatting Simple example​ CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Installation Next Plot Simple example
Getting Started Installation Installation NPM​ npm i react-plot yarn​ yarn add react-plot Edit this page Previous Introduction Next Basics

Hooks Basic On this page Basic Low level hooks used by other hooks but can also be used natively. Currently we support the following basic hooks: useStartMoveEnd usePlotControllerAxes useStartMoveEnd​ The low level hook useStartMoveEnd allows to track the mouse. It accepts 3 callbacks: onStart: the mouse was clicked onMove: the mouse was dragged onEnd: the mouse was released In the following example we simply log different events. undefined CodeOpen sandbox usePlotControllerAxes​ The low level hook usePlotControllerAxes allows to track axis state (max, min) after any modification. In the following example we simply log axes domain while using UseRectangularZoom. undefined CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Introduction Next Draw useStartMoveEnd usePlotControllerAxes

Hooks Draw On this page Draw More advanced hook will not only monitor the movement of the mouse but will also return annotations that can directly be drawn in the Plot. currently we support the following drawing hooks: useDrawRectangle useDrawPath useDrawRectangle​ There are 3 steps in order ot implement the draw rectangle: wrap your plot component in <PlotController> add the hook: const drawRectangle = useDrawRectangle(); add the drawRectangle.annotations in order to draw the zoom rectangle: <Annotations>{drawRectangle.annotations}</Annotations> Draw a rectangle CodeOpen sandbox useDrawPath​ There are 3 steps in order to implement the draw path: wrap your plot component in <PlotController> add the hook: const drawPath = useDrawPath(); add the drawPath.annotations in order to draw the path: <Annotations>{drawPath.annotations}</Annotations> Draw a path CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Basic Next Functional useDrawRectangle useDrawPath

Hooks Functional On this page Functional These hooks allow you to do specific precoded functionalities. Currently we support following functional hooks: useAxisZoom useRectangularZoom useAxisWheelZoom useCrossHair usePan useAxisZoom​ This hook allows to zoom in a plot along the specified axis (default to horizontal) while drawing a rectangle. There are 3 steps in order to implement the zoom: wrap your plot component in <PlotController> add the hook: const zoom = useAxisZoom({direction:'horizontal'}); add the zoom.annotations in order to draw the zoom rectangle: <Annotations>{zoom.annotations}</Annotations> This hook also implements the double click detection to reset the zoom to its original value. Draw a rectangle CodeOpen sandbox useRectangularZoom​ This hook allows to directly manage the zoom in a plot. There are 3 steps in order to implement the zoom: wrap your plot component in <PlotController> add the hook: const zoom = useRectangularZoom(); add the zoom.annotations in order to draw the zoom rectangle: <Annotations>{zoom.annotations}</Annotations> This hook also implements the double click detection to reset the zoom to its original value. Draw a rectangle CodeOpen sandbox If a PlotController contains several Plot elements, the change will be applied on all of them. Draw a rectangle Draw a rectangle CodeOpen sandbox useAxisWheelZoom​ This hook allows to zoom in a plot along the specified axis (default to vertical) using mouse wheel. The hook may be customized with following props: center : it defines zoom center, used to choose a specific point or the mouse cursor "pointer" as zoom center type : number | "pointer" default : 0 factor : controls zoom speed type : number default : "0" invert : inverts wheel zooming (default wheel up will zoom in our plot) type : string default : false There are 2 steps in order to implement the wheel zoom: wrap your plot component in <PlotController> add the hook: useAxisWheelZoom({direction:'vertical', center:0, factor:1, invert:false}) This hook also implements the double click detection to reset the zoom to its original value. Scroll inside the plot CodeOpen sandbox useCrossHair​ This hook adds crossHair to the plot . The hook may be customized with the following props: color : crossHair color type : string default : "black" lineStyle : adds style to crossHair line type : CSSProperties default : {} textStyle : adds style to crossHair text type : CSSProperties default : {} textTransform : trasforms crossHair text type : string default : "" There are 3 steps in order to implement the crossHair: wrap your plot component in <PlotController> add the hook: const crossHair = useCrossHair(); add the crossHair.annotations in order to draw CrossHair: <Annotations>{crossHair.annotations}</Annotations> Move the mouse inside CodeOpen sandbox usePan​ This hook adds an interactive pan to the plot to move in any direction while holding ALT. There are 2 steps in order to implement the pan: wrap your plot component in <PlotController> add the hook: usePan(); This hook also implements the double click detection to reset the zoom to its original value. Press ALT, Grab and drag CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Draw Next Introduction useAxisZoom useRectangularZoom useAxisWheelZoom useCrossHair usePan

Hooks Introduction On this page Introduction Draw a rectangle CodeOpen sandbox react-plot provides hook that allows to add functionalities to the plot. To benefit of those features the hooks have to be wrapped in a PlotController. Some hooks like useRectangularZoom will apply by default to all the Plot components contained in the PlotController. In the same page there may be multiple Plot components group in different PlotController components. Hooks​ In order to understand hooks, we have divided them into three categories : Basic : low level hook helps to create your own functionalities Draw : allows you to draw in your plot Functional : precoded functionality Edit this page Previous Group Next Basic Hooks

Illustrations Heading On this page Heading Heading represents the plot label TitleSubtitle CodeOpen sandbox Restriction​ Plot can only have one Heading element Props​ Mandatory​ title: heading title text content type: string Optional​ titleStyle: customises title style type: CSSProperties default: {} titleClass: adds a class to the title type: string default: "" TitleSubtitle CodeOpen sandbox subtitle: heading subtitle text content type: string default: "" subtitleStyle: customises subtitle style type: CSSProperties default: {} subtitleClass: adds a class to the subtitle type: string<br default: "" TitleSubtitle CodeOpen sandbox position: adds a class to the subtitle type: 'top' | 'bottom'<br default: 'top' Top heading Bottom heading CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Introduction Next Legend Restriction Props Mandatory Optional

Illustrations Introduction On this page Introduction This category is used for better understanding of data, allows to explain Plot formatting Currently we support following illustrations: Heading Legend Example​ Graph HeadingSubtitle CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Functional Next Heading Example

Illustrations Legend On this page Legend Legend is an component that describes each of Series of the Plot, it's also used to interact with them. CodeOpen sandbox Restriction​ In order to add a Serie in Legend you must specify its label It's not possible to set top and bottom, left and right offsets at the same time Props​ position: determines Legend position in the plot type: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right'| 'embedded' default: 'embedded' embeded top bottom left right CodeOpen sandbox margin: adds spacing out of legend type: number default: 10 CodeOpen sandbox onClick: Creates a callback when clicking to one of legend's elements, event: MouseEvent data, id: id of clicked serie type: (args: {event: React.MouseEvent<SVGGElement, MouseEvent>;id: string;}) => void labelStyle: changes legend style in general or for specific serie's label type: CSSFuncProps default: {} lineStyle: changes line style in general or for specific serie's label type: CSSFuncProps default: {} Click on legend series CodeOpen sandbox showHide: activates "show/hide" functionality that allows you to hide and show series when clicking on it in the legend type: boolean default: false Click on legend series CodeOpen sandbox top changes top legend offset that cannot be defined with bottom type: number bottom changes bottom legend offset that be cannot defined with top type: number left changes top legend offset that cannot be defined with right type: number right changes top legend offset that cannot be defined with left type: number CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Heading Next Data Restriction Props

Plot On this page Plot Plot is the container of all other components, and the main component in react-plot that creates the plot svg CodeOpen sandbox Allowed children​ Plot children must be one of the following components : Series components Axes components Annotations Heading Legend Props​ Plot viewportSeries viewportWidthHeightMargin CodeOpen sandbox Mandatory​ width: Width of the SVG in pixels type: number height: Height of the SVG in pixels type: number Optional​ colorScheme: Color scheme used to pick colors for the series type: Iterable<string> default: "schemeSet1" from "d3-scale-chromatic" margin: Pixel distance between seriesViewport and plotViewport. type: {top?:number, bottom?:number, left?:number, right?:number} default: {} svgStyle: Style applied to the SVG element type: CSSProperties default: {} svgId: Id of the SVG element type: string default: generated automatically svgClassName: Class name of the SVG element type: string default: "" plotViewportStyle: Style applied to the rectangle around the entire plot type: CSSProperties default: {} seriesViewportStyle: Style applied to the rectangle around the series viewport type: CSSProperties default: {} controllerId: Id of the parent PlotController that will control this plot type: string default: "" Edit this page Previous Basics Next BoxPlot Allowed children Props Mandatory Optional

Series BarSeries On this page BarSeries Display​ CodeOpen sandbox Data​ point type must extend from SeriesPoint Props​ Like all other series, bar series have Base props They also have other props that we can class into the following categories : 1. Markers​ displayMarkers: displays scatter points markers type: boolean default: false markerShape: serie's markers shape type: Shape default: 'circle' markerSize: changes size of serie's markers type: number default: 8 markerStyle:changes style of serie's markers. Can be dynamic or static type: CSSFuncProps default: {} CodeOpen sandbox 2. Point Label​ pointLabel: serie's point label that can be static or dynamic depending on kind of points type: LabelFuncProps<point> default: '' pointLabelStyle: serie's point label style, static or dynamic depending on kind of points type: CSSFuncProps<point> default: {} CodeOpen sandbox 3. ErrorBars​ displayErrorBars: displays error bars in the series type: boolean default: false errorBarsStyle: changes error bars style type: SVGAttributes<SVGLineElement> errorBarsCapSize: changes size of error bars cap type: number errorBarsCapStyle: changes error bars cap's style type: SVGAttributes<SVGLineElement> CodeOpen sandbox 4. Lines​ lineStyle: styling of the serie's path static or dynamic that depends on series id type: CSSFuncProps<{id}> default: false CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous LineSeries Next FunctionSeries Display Data Props 1. Markers 2. Point Label 3. ErrorBars 4. Lines

Series FunctionSeries On this page FunctionSeries Display​ CodeOpen sandbox Restriction​ You must specify the horizontal domain to use FunctionSeries otherwise the plot will not be displayed (next example) CodeOpen sandbox To set the horizontal domain use one of these options : Add horizontal Axis and determine max and min props <Axis min={0} max={20} position="bottom" /> Add another Series to the plot. It will automatically specify the domain of horizontal axis CodeOpen sandbox Data​ In FunctionSeries we don't have data props we just need to precise our function using getY callback Example:​ We want to display y=f(x), where f is a declared function getY={(x)=>f(x)} CodeOpen sandbox Props​ Like all other series, function series have Base props They also have other props that we can class into the following categories : 1. Function​ getY: (Mandatory) function that you want to display type: (x:number)=>number 2. Lines​ lineStyle: styling of the serie's path static or dynamic depending on series id type: CSSFuncProps<{id}> default: false CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous BarSeries Next RangeSeries Display Restriction Data Props 1. Function 2. Lines

Series Introduction On this page Introduction There are currently 5 different types of series that can be added to a plot: ScatterSeries LineSeries BarSeries FunctionSeries RangeSeries Series are direct children of the Plot component and you may have as many Series as you wish on the same plot. Data​ The main purpose of react-plot is to display different data in different ways. Data is an array of points that differ from one serie to another Base Props​ Base props are the props that all series have: Mandatory​ data: displays serie's data type: Data Optional​ id: serie id type: string default: generated automatically xAxis: series horizontal axis id type: string default: "x" yAxis: series vertical axis id type: string default: "y" label: label of the serie that can be displayed in legends type: string hidden: hides serie type: boolean default: false xShift: shifts the data relative to horizontal axis type: number or string default: 0 yShift: shifts the data relative to vertical axis type: number or string default: 0 Example​ CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous BoxPlot Next ScatterSeries Data Base Props Example

Series LineSeries On this page LineSeries Display​ CodeOpen sandbox Data​ point type must extend from SeriesPoint Props​ Like all other series, line series have Base props They also have many other props that we can class into following categories : 1. Markers​ displayMarkers: displays scatter points markers type: boolean default: false markerShape: shape of serie's markers type: Shape default: 'circle' markerSize: size of serie's markers type: number default: 8 markerStyle: serie's markers style that can be dynamic or static type: CSSFuncProps default: {} CodeOpen sandbox 2. Point Label​ pointLabel: serie's point label that can be dynamic or static, depending on kind of points type: LabelFuncProps<point> default: '' pointLabelStyle: serie's point label style, dynamic or static, depending on kind of points type: CSSFuncProps<point> default: {} CodeOpen sandbox 3. ErrorBars​ displayErrorBars: displays error bars in the series type: boolean default: false errorBarsStyle: changes error bars' style type: SVGAttributes<SVGLineElement> errorBarsCapSize: changes size of error bars' cap type: number errorBarsCapStyle: changes error bars cap's style type: SVGAttributes<SVGLineElement> CodeOpen sandbox 4. Lines​ lineStyle: styling of the serie's path dynamic or static, depending on series' id type: CSSFuncProps<{id}> default: false CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous ScatterSeries Next BarSeries Display Data Props 1. Markers 2. Point Label 3. ErrorBars 4. Lines

Series RangeSeries On this page RangeSeries Display​ CodeOpen sandbox Data​ point type must extend from RangeSeriesPoint Props​ Like all other series, range series have Base props, and one more additional prop: lineStyle: style of range serie type: CSSProperties default: '' CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous FunctionSeries Next Introduction Display Data Props

Series ScatterSeries On this page ScatterSeries Display​ CodeOpen sandbox Data​ point type must extend from SeriesPoint Props​ Like all other series, scatter series have Base props, but in addition to that they also have many other props that we can class into the following categories : 1. Markers​ displayMarkers: display scatter points markers type: boolean default: true markerShape: serie's shape of a marker. Can be either dynamic or static type: ShapeFuncProps default: 'circle' markerSize: serie's size of a marker type: number default: 8 markerStyle: serie's markers style (static / dynamic) type: CSSFuncProps default: {} CodeOpen sandbox 2. Point Label​ pointLabel: serie's point label (static / dynamic) type: LabelFuncProps default: '' pointLabelStyle: serie's point label style (static / dynamic) type: CSSFuncProps default: {} CodeOpen sandbox 3. ErrorBars​ displayErrorBars: displays error bars in the serie type: boolean default: false errorBarsStyle: changes error bars style type: SVGAttributes<SVGLineElement> errorBarsCapSize: size of error bars' cap type: number errorBarsCapStyle: changes error bars' cap style type: SVGAttributes<SVGLineElement> CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Introduction Next LineSeries Display Data Props 1. Markers 2. Point Label 3. ErrorBars

Types Data On this page Data this type is used to define Series data type The used data must be extended from the following types: 1. SeriesPoint​ Definition​ In Typescript: Array<{x:number,y:number}> Explanation: Array of points, each point must have two coordinates as a number, x for horizantal Axis and y for vertical Axis Example: [ { x: 1, y: 1 }, { x: 2, y: 5 }, { x: 3, y: 3 }, { x: 4, y: 2 }, { x: 5, y: 1 } ] Utilities​ This type is used in : ScatterSeries LineSeries BarSeries Example​ CodeOpen sandbox 2. RangeSeriesPoint​ Definition​ In Typescript: Array<{x:number,y1:number,y2:number}> Explanation: Array of points, each point must have three coordinates as a number, x for horizontal Axis and y1,y2 to specify the range for vertical Axis Example : [ { x: 1, y1: 0, y2: 2 }, { x: 2, y1: 2, y2: 3 }, { x: 3, y1: 3, y2: 4 } ] Utilities​ This type is used in: RangeSeries Example​ CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Legend Next ScalarValue 1. SeriesPoint Definition Utilities Example 2. RangeSeriesPoint Definition Utilities Example

Types ScalarValue On this page ScalarValue This type is mainly used to allow more possibilities and ways to enter props We currently allow following three types : 1. Number​ Definition​ In Typescript: number Example: 3,5 Utilities​ The value is converted using Axis scale Example​ 2616 CodeOpen sandbox 2. Pixels​ Definition​ In Typescript: '${number}' Explanation: String number Example: '3','5' Utilities​ The value is in pixels, independent from scale and Axis Example​ 100px200px400px CodeOpen sandbox 3. Percentage​ Definition​ In Typescript: '${number}%' Explanation: String number ends with "%" Example: '3%','5%' Utilities​ The value is converted depending on Axis domain Examples​ 10%20%50% CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Data Next Infrared spectrum 1. Number Definition Utilities Example 2. Pixels Definition Utilities Example 3. Percentage Definition Utilities Examples
